intro: Babiana praemorsa, commonly known as the rainstorm lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its bulbs are adapted to store water, allowing it to survive dry periods. The flowers are often pink or purple, with a distinctive spurred petal that aids in pollination by attracting specific insects.
